segments.text: The kitchen is so ordinary and yet so chaotic; it’s like I’m watching a scene from a play.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is too focused on her chores to see the disaster brewing behind her, and it’s almost frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel tension building in the air as the boy reaches for those cookies, oh how reckless he is!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His foot slips, and I can see how close he is to falling; I hold my breath.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then there’s the girl, looking so eager, it makes me smile even amidst the madness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light coming through the window seems to mock the chaos inside; it’s too bright for this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I never understood how one moment of distraction could lead to so many dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR
